subject: Nutrition
title: Sugar Is Addictive Like Cocaine
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sugar Is Addictive Like Cocaine usable.

hook.text: Headlines claimed sugar lights up the same brain regions as cocaine. That comparison is misleading.

buildup.text: Dopamine is released by sugarâ€”but also by music, exercise, laughter, and petting a dog.

discovery.text: Addiction involves tolerance, withdrawal, and compulsive use despite harm. Sugar doesn't meet all criteria.

twist.text: The rat studies behind the claim used sugar-deprived animals. Humans don't eat under those conditions.

climax.text: Sugar can drive overconsumption, but calling it addictive trivializes actual substance addiction.

punchline.text: Sugar is hard to resist. That doesn't make it a drug.

quiz.question: What also triggers dopamine release like sugar does?
